questions.questionText: How are your digital service offerings defined and managed?

options.text: Ad-hoc; services are created as per client requests without formal definition.
Services are loosely defined, primarily through informal discussions.
Services have basic definitions and scopes, but may vary per project.
Services are clearly defined, documented, and have standardized components.
Services are modular, well-documented, continuously updated, and designed for scalability and reusability.

questions.questionText: To what extent do you tailor your services to specific MSME needs?

options.text: Minimal tailoring; services are generic.
Some customization based on direct client requests.
We attempt to understand client needs and adapt existing services.
We have a structured process for assessing MSME needs and proposing tailored solutions.
Deep understanding of MSME segments, offering highly customized and flexible service packages.

questions.questionText: Do your service offerings leverage or integrate with Free and Open Source Software (FOSS) or Open API Specifications?

options.text: No, we primarily use proprietary solutions.
Unaware of FOSS/Open APIs benefits, or use them passively.
We use some FOSS but not strategically; Open APIs are used if required by client.
We actively integrate FOSS and utilize Open APIs to offer flexible and cost-effective solutions.
Strategic FOSS adoption and Open API utilization are core to our service development and integration capabilities.

questions.questionText: How are projects managed from initiation to completion?

options.text: Ad-hoc; projects are managed informally, success depends on individual effort.
Basic project tracking; some informal communication about progress.
Projects follow a defined, but not always consistent, methodology (e.g., waterfall, basic agile).
Standardized project management processes (e.g., Agile, Scrum, Kanban) are consistently applied.
Optimized project delivery with continuous improvement, predictive analytics, and proactive risk management.

questions.questionText: How do you ensure the quality of the services and solutions delivered?

options.text: Quality is checked only at the end by the client.
Informal checks are done during the project.
Basic quality assurance (QA) steps are included in the process.
Formal QA processes, testing, and feedback loops are integrated into delivery.
Continuous quality assurance, automated testing, and proactive performance monitoring are standard.

questions.questionText: How transparent are you with clients regarding project progress, issues, and changes?

options.text: Limited communication, mostly reactive.
Updates are provided upon client request.
Regular scheduled updates, but sometimes lacking detail.
Proactive and structured communication (e.g., regular meetings, shared dashboards).
Real-time transparency, collaborative platforms, and clear escalation paths.

questions.questionText: What is the depth and breadth of your technical expertise relevant to MSME digital needs (e.g., web development, cloud, cybersecurity, AI)?

options.text: Limited expertise, mostly basic web or single service.
Some basic skills across a few digital domains.
Competent in a few key digital areas; able to handle standard requests.
Strong expertise across multiple digital domains, capable of complex solutions.
Leading-edge expertise in diverse digital technologies, including emerging trends (AI, IoT), with continuous upskilling.

questions.questionText: How do you stay updated with new technologies and industry best practices?

options.text: We don't have a formal process.
Ad-hoc individual learning.
Informal team discussions; occasional online learning.
Regular training, certifications, and dedicated R&D time for new technologies.
Embedded R&D culture, active participation in industry forums, and continuous learning initiatives.

questions.questionText: Do you have a dedicated approach to cybersecurity for your own systems and clients' solutions?

options.text: No specific measures beyond basic antivirus.
Reliance on basic platform security; ad-hoc fixes.
Basic security practices implemented, but not formalized.
Defined security policies, regular security audits, and staff training.
Proactive security strategy, incident response plan, vulnerability management, and continuous monitoring.

questions.questionText: How do you handle client support and issue resolution after project delivery?

options.text: No formal support; clients contact individual team members directly.
Basic email/phone support, often slow response times.
Defined support channels (e.g., helpdesk email/number) with inconsistent response.
Structured support system (e.g., ticketing system, SLAs) with clear response times.
Proactive support, dedicated account managers, self-service portals, and continuous client feedback loops.

questions.questionText: How do you gather and act on client feedback to improve your services?

options.text: We rarely seek or use feedback.
Informal feedback is sometimes received.
We occasionally ask for feedback, but act on it inconsistently.
Structured feedback mechanisms (e.g., surveys, reviews) are in place, influencing service improvements.
Continuous feedback loops, integrated into service design, driving measurable improvements and client satisfaction.

questions.questionText: How well-defined are your internal processes for operations, finance, and HR?

options.text: Mostly informal and ad-hoc.
Some basic documented procedures.
Key processes are defined, but not consistently followed or integrated.
Standardized and documented processes are generally followed across the organization.
Fully optimized and integrated processes, supported by automation and continuous improvement.

questions.questionText: Do you have clear contractual agreements and service level agreements (SLAs) with your clients?

options.text: No formal agreements; reliance on verbal understanding.
Basic agreements, but without specific service level details.
Formal contracts, but SLAs might be vague or not consistently met.
Clear, detailed contracts with measurable SLAs, regularly reviewed.
Comprehensive, legally sound contracts with performance-based SLAs, ensuring mutual accountability.

questions.questionText: How do you manage your business's financial health and pricing models for MSMEs?

options.text: Pricing is ad-hoc; financial management is reactive.
Basic financial tracking; simple pricing.
Defined pricing models, but not always transparent or optimized for MSMEs.
Transparent and flexible pricing models, with proactive financial planning.
Strategic financial management, value-based pricing, and flexible models catering to diverse MSME budgets.
